thread.title: Vaughan daycare operators charged with obstruction
thread.title_full: Vaughan daycare operators charged with obstruction | Toronto Star

author: Brennan Doherty
title: Vaughan daycare operators charged with obstruction
text:
The owners of a Vaughan daycare have been charged with obstruction of a police investigation, as part of an ongoing investigation into the death of two-year old Eva Ravikovich in 2013.
Olena Panfilova, 49, and Karina Rabadanova, 26, of Vaughan were arrested Wednesday without incident.
Police believe they were attempting to destroy evidence and interfere with the ongoing police investigation.
The daycare owners have been under investigation since July 2013, when emergency services found 2-year old Eva without vital signs at the home.
Health inspectors later found that the home was filthy and overcrowded, with infected diapers and traces of listeria bacteria.
Home daycares are only allowed to operate without a license in Ontario if they care for five children or less.
The Ministry of Education said during the investigation that four complaints had been made about the home before Evaâ€™s death.
They are scheduled to appear in the Ontario Court of Justice on Nov. 12.
With files from Alex Ballingall
